stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on building the Boshi quick-draw duel: modelling a cork-gun for Mario, scripting the 3-2-1/“Fire!” countdown, juggling Boshi’s egg animation and fine-tuning the cut-scene cameras. He also shows the game running on real N64 hardware (40 FPS), discusses an overworld crash, and mentions two secretly finished areas and an imminent small ROM-hack release based on his upgraded engine.

development_findings.summary: Two new areas were completed off-stream but kept secret due to a collaboration partner’s request.
development_findings.quote: There’s two levels … I made off-stream that I can’t show you yet, because I’m supposed to keep it secret.

development_findings.summary: Engine received a polish pass for an upcoming ‘small ROM-hack’ and will underpin all future releases.
development_findings.quote: I also polished up the entire engine for it … basically everything I’m going to release is going to use my engine.

development_findings.summary: Running on physical N64 now reaches ~40 FPS before further optimisation; overworld currently crashes.
development_findings.quote: How f***ing cool is that? 40 FPS before we even optimised it … The overworld is really wrong right now.

development_findings.summary: Planned optimisation: cull two large support beams in Course 5 to skip triangle processing.
development_findings.quote: We can make it so that they cull … We weren’t doing that.

development_findings.summary: Boshi duel design: randomised delay after ‘3-2-1’; early shots explode; first attempt demands ~280 ms reaction, then adds 3 frames per failure; considers HUD vs world-space countdown and cinematic camera.
development_findings.quote: Likely we have to go at least 300 milliseconds … If Mario shoots early his gun explodes.

development_findings.summary: Cut-scene workflow: switches from HUD numbers to a ‘Fire’ cut-scene, letter-boxing ideas, eye-state tweaks, multi-angle camera and widescreen/4:3 compatibility.
Egg projectile model decimated to 0.75 with minor UV fixes to fit RAM budget of the level.
development_findings.quote: This level already has a huge RAM issue … maybe we can do 0.75 and fix a few UV mapping issues.

development_findings.summary: New sine/cos approximation emailed by a fan may yield further speed gains; Kaze will test off-stream.
development_findings.quote: Someone just emailed me a new sine and cosine approximation that might actually be worth it.

development_findings.summary: Anti-savestate system: ‘space-time Yoshi’ detects emulator savestates and delivers rap verses; raps likely to be rewritten for quality/localisation.
development_findings.quote: The game detects save states … a space-time Yoshi appears and tells you not to save state and he will rap at you.

development_findings.summary: Project scope: ~180 stars planned; only three main levels remain (last 20 % of game) but months of work left.
development_findings.quote: Do you guys actually realise how crazy it is how close we’re done … only three levels are missing.

context_findings.summary: Kaze insists on optimising for real N64 hardware first, not emulator convenience.
context_findings.quote: I don’t optimise for emulator at all. I just do for hardware and then the emulator is hopefully good enough.

context_findings.summary: Strong concern about Nintendo DMCA; past takedowns (Missing Link, Last Impact, Net64) guide his release strategy.
context_findings.quote: Had Nintendo not interfered, I would have a lot more videos … They already took down 70 % of my videos.

context_findings.summary: Plans to bundle the game’s trailer with a Kickstarter for his next project; will upload ‘copyright-free’ versions to mitigate takedowns.
context_findings.quote: I’m going to bundle it together with the ad for my Kickstarter … and release a copyright-free version.

context_findings.summary: Rejects pay-walling content; no Patreon exclusives to avoid ‘baiting’ fans.
context_findings.quote: I’m not making any Patreon exclusives. I don’t want people to even think I’m trying to bait people into my Patreon.

context_findings.summary: Personal moments: frustration with loud house fan (“gates of hell”), excitement when gun finally renders, playful disdain for fart humour and Disney parks.

biobak.summary: Checks in on stream; Kaze notes Biobak will ‘look over’ and improve models after his initial passes.
biobak.quote: Usually after I’m done, we got Biobak looking over it and he makes them a lot better.

zeina.summary: Zeina is babysitting during the stream, reducing her animation contributions for the day.
zeina.quote: Can you believe Zeina’s on babysitting instead of making games with me right now?

key_stories.title: Nintendo Video Takedowns and the ‘Wario with No Assets’ Re-upload
key_stories.summary: Nintendo removed around 20 of Kaze’s YouTube videos, including a Net64 Wario showcase. He re-uploaded the video stripped of all Nintendo content, parodying the takedown.
key_stories.challenge: Maintaining visibility while avoiding Nintendo’s DMCA strikes.
key_stories.process: Re-created the video using only original voices and blank geometry.
key_stories.outcome: Demonstrated creativity in sidestepping legal pressure; informs future trailer strategy.
key_stories.key_quote: Nintendo just took like 20 videos of mine down … so I re-uploaded it without any Nintendo content.

key_stories.title: Building the Boshi Quick-Draw Minigame
key_stories.summary: Kaze designs a Western-style duel where Mario faces Boshi, juggling an egg and firing a cork gun. He iterates on countdown UX, camera angles, reaction-time logic and model rigging.
key_stories.challenge: Creating an engaging, readable minigame that respects N64 limits.
key_stories.process: Experimented with HUD vs world-space numbers, changed to cut-scene with ‘Fire!’, added random delays, rigged gun via invisible Mario skeleton to avoid per-frame matrix capture.
key_stories.outcome: Core visuals and logic finished; shooting mechanics slated for next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I got the gun to render for free … We did it.

key_stories.title: Overworld Crash vs 40 FPS Success
key_stories.summary: While celebrating 40 FPS on real hardware, Kaze discovers the overworld now crashes. He isolates the issue and plans geometry culling for optimisation.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing performance gains with new stability issues.
key_stories.process: Booted game on N64 flash-cart, walked through Course 5, noted crash only in overworld, planned beam-culling fix.
key_stories.outcome: Performance proof-of-concept achieved; overworld bug logged for future fix.
key_stories.key_quote: Don’t worry though about the overworld crash. We knew something was wrong with the overworld.

key_stories.title: Space-Time Yoshi vs Savestates
key_stories.summary: Kaze shows rap verses delivered by a special Yoshi that appears if the player uses emulator savestates, warning them of temporal crimes.
key_stories.challenge: Discouraging savestate abuse in a humorous way.
key_stories.process: Wrote 16 short rap stanzas; community reacts with mixed feedback; considers rewrites and localisation.
key_stories.outcome: Mechanic exists but raps flagged for improvement; open call for better lyrics.
key_stories.key_quote: If you save state in the game, a space-time Yoshi appears and tells you not to save state and he will rap at you.

open_questions.topic: Secret Off-Stream Areas & Upcoming Small ROM-Hack
open_questions.context: Kaze finished two areas and a ‘small ROM-hack’ using the new engine but cannot reveal details.
questions: What are the themes and design goals of these secret areas?
How does the smaller ROM-hack test or showcase the engine improvements?
Who is the collaborator and how did the partnership come about?

open_questions.context: Engine was polished and serves as backbone for all future projects; Kaze is undecided on open-sourcing.
questions: What are the core innovations of the engine compared to vanilla SM64 decomp?
Which optimisation (e.g., new sine/cos, quaternion translations) brought the biggest gains?
Under what conditions would Kaze release the engine’s source code?

open_questions.context: Game runs on real N64 but overworld crashes immediately.
questions: What debugging steps has Kaze taken so far?
Is the crash geometry, memory or script related?
How is stability tested on-console vs emulator?

open_questions.topic: Final Design of Boshi Reaction-Time Duel
open_questions.context: Multiple UX variations (HUD numbers, ‘Fire’ cut-scene, letterbox) were tested.
questions: What criteria will decide the final countdown presentation?
How will early-shot penalties and redemption arc be implemented?
Will duel support multiplayer modes?

open_questions.context: Community finds current lyrics ‘cringe’; Kaze invites rewrites.
questions: What tone is desired—comedic, threatening, fourth-wall?
How will multiple languages be supported?
Could voice acting be involved (e.g., Badub or guest rapper)?

open_questions.context: Lilaa is implementing quaternion support that may allow free translation in animations.
questions: What technical hurdles exist in adding translation to SM64 animations?
What performance gains are predicted?
Timeline for integration into Return to Yoshi’s Island?

open_questions.topic: Release Timing vs Nintendo First-Party Schedule
open_questions.context: Fear of immediate takedown if hack releases near a big Nintendo title.
questions: How will the team monitor Nintendo’s release calendar?
Are contingency plans in place (mirrors, torrents, legal counsel)?
Could staggered ‘soft-launch’ to Patreon/Discord reduce risk?

open_questions.context: Stream shows ad-hoc collaboration (Biobak model pass, Zeina animation when not babysitting).
questions: What is the day-to-day workflow among Kaze, Biobak, Badub, Zeina?
How are tasks tracked and reviewed?
How does married life intersect with Kaze & Zeina’s creative process?
